applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the structure, operation and benefits of a pension scheme, not a complaints handling procedure. 2) While AIB Life is mentioned as the life office and registered administrator, this document specifically deals with the trust structure, benefits, and administration of the pension scheme rather than operational procedures like complaints handling. 3) The document makes no mention of consumer complaints processes or governance arrangements for handling complaints. 4) The scheme described is an occupational pension scheme governed primarily by the Pensions Act and Revenue requirements, not consumer protection regulations. 5) The relationship described in the document is between employer, trustee and member rather than a direct consumer relationship that would fall under consumer protection regulations for complaints handling.
regulation_text: 107. (1) A regulated entity shall implement robust governance arrangements for the appropriate handling of complaints from consumers. (2) The arrangements referred to in paragraph (1) shall include - (a) processes for the proper oversight of complaints handling, (b) analysis on a regular basis and, in that regard, at least once every 6 months, of the rate of occurrence and patterns of complaints, which shall include complaints resolved within 5 working days, and (c) arrangements within the regulated entity for reporting to the compliance or risk function of the regulated entity, or any other relevant function of the regulated entity as required, as well as to the board of directors, or the entity or persons contro lling the regulated entity, of aggregated information on the number of complaints handled and resolved, and on the analysis referred to in subparagraph (b). Chapter 13 Unsolicited personal visits and telephone calls
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
